Improving your sleep starts with knowing what actually happened while you were asleep! Your Sleep Score delivers a snapshot of your sleep quality and a full report of your sleep patterns and quantity of your sleep.
A measure of the total number of hours you slept during the night. The average adult requires between 7â€“9 hours sleep.
A measure of the total time it took you to fall to sleep. This phase of sleep is known as sleep latency.
A measure of the portion of time you were asleep versus portion of time you spent lying awake. High sleep efficiency is above 85%.
A measure of the total time you were restless during your sleep, but not awake.
A measure of the total number of times during your sleep that you woke up.
A measure of the total number of times that you broke your sleep entirely and got out of bed.
A measure of the total portion of time you spent snoring while you were asleep.
A measure of your average heart rate while sleeping.
Let\'s find your sleeping devices and get your Sleepsense bed set up
Don\'t have a Sleepsense bed?\nFIND OUT MORE
This will help me adjust to you accurately
Close Sleepsense before setting up your sleep hardware?

Please select the side of the bed you sleep on
